result.markdown:
---
title: "Insula DAISIE"
author: Luis Valente
---


## Example of how to extract data for Jamaica species from the *Insula* tree, add missing species, fit DAISIE models and run simulations.

### Load required packages


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
rm(list=ls())
library(ape)
library(DAISIEprep)
library(DAISIE)
```
:::


### Load tree


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
Insula_tree<-read.nexus("data/Insula.tre")
```
:::


Visualise tree (easier to use Figtree!)


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(Insula_tree)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](insula_DAISIE_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Prepare data using DAISIEprep

Look in the [checklist](data/Insula_checklist.xlsx) to see which species occur on Jamaica. Specify tips corresponding to Jamaica species by specifying that they are endemic and/or non-endemic to the island:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
island_species <- data.frame(
  tip_labels = c("Spec_29",
                 "Spec_48",
                 "Spec_47",
                 "Spec_38",
                 "Spec_43",
                 "Spec_42",
                 "Spec_39",
                 "Spec_33",
                 "Spec_26",
                 "Spec_19",
                 "Spec_41",
                 "Spec_40",
                 "Spec_25",
                 "Spec_9",
                 "Spec_24")
  ,
  tip_endemicity_status = c(rep("endemic",14),"nonendemic"))
```
:::


Assign island endemicity status to all species in the dataset (including the non-Jamaican species)


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
endemicity_status <- create_endemicity_status(
  phylo = Insula_tree,
  island_species = island_species
)
```
:::


Add endemicity status to the phylogeny


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
phylod <- phylobase::phylo4d(Insula_tree, endemicity_status)
```
:::


Visualize this on the tree


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot_phylod(phylod = phylod)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](insula_DAISIE_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Extract data from the phylogeny using the min algorithm


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
island_tbl_min <- extract_island_species(
  phylod = phylod,
  extraction_method = "min"
)
island_tbl_min
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Class:  Island_tbl 
  clade_name     status missing_species  col_time col_max_age branching_times
1     Spec_9    endemic               0 0.2892541       FALSE              NA
2    Spec_19    endemic               0 0.4972437       FALSE    0.207998....
3    Spec_24 nonendemic               0 0.1694692       FALSE              NA
4    Spec_25    endemic               0 0.5035954       FALSE    0.165789....
5    Spec_29    endemic               0 0.1166231       FALSE              NA
  min_age      species clade_type
1      NA       Spec_9          1
2      NA Spec_19,....          1
3      NA      Spec_24          1
4      NA Spec_25,....          1
5      NA      Spec_29          1
```
:::
:::


Extract data from the phylogeny using the ancestral state algorithm


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
phylod <- add_asr_node_states(phylod = phylod, asr_method = "mk")
plot_phylod(phylod = phylod)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](insula_DAISIE_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
island_tbl_asr <- extract_island_species(
  phylod = phylod,
  extraction_method = "asr"
)
island_tbl_asr
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Class:  Island_tbl 
  clade_name     status missing_species  col_time col_max_age branching_times
1     Spec_9    endemic               0 0.2892541       FALSE              NA
2    Spec_19    endemic               0 0.4972437       FALSE    0.207998....
3    Spec_24 nonendemic               0 0.1694692       FALSE              NA
4    Spec_25    endemic               0 0.5035954       FALSE    0.165789....
5    Spec_29    endemic               0 0.1166231       FALSE              NA
  min_age      species clade_type
1      NA       Spec_9          1
2      NA Spec_19,....          1
3      NA      Spec_24          1
4      NA Spec_25,....          1
5      NA      Spec_29          1
```
:::
:::


Compare 2 options:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
all.equal(island_tbl_min,island_tbl_asr)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] TRUE
```
:::
:::


As you can see, the results of the 2 extractions (min and asr) are exactly the same in this case, so we can use either for the subsequent analyses.

### Add missing species

Add missing species "Spec_51", which is not closely related to any species


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
island_tbl<-island_tbl_min
island_tbl <- add_island_colonist(
  island_tbl = island_tbl,
  clade_name = "Spec_51",
  status = "endemic",
  missing_species = 0,
  col_time = NA_real_,
  col_max_age = FALSE,
  branching_times = NA_real_,
  min_age = NA_real_,
  clade_type = 1,
  species = "Spec_51"
)
```
:::


Add missing species Spec_52, closely related to Spec_42


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
island_tbl <- add_missing_species(
  island_tbl = island_tbl,
  num_missing_species = 1, 
  species_to_add_to = "Spec_42"
)
```
:::


Create DAISIE datalist


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
insula_data_list <- create_daisie_data(
  data = island_tbl,
  island_age = 4,
  num_mainland_species = 1000,
  precise_col_time = TRUE
)
```
:::


## Fit DAISIE models to data

Fit model with 5 parameters


::: {.cell hash='insula_DAISIE_cache/html/M1_4253780b71cb99ecbb775571d73a5b5b'}

```{.r .cell-code}
M1<-DAISIE_ML(
  datalist = insula_data_list,
  initparsopt = c(1.5,1.1,20,0.009,1.1),
  ddmodel = 11,
  idparsopt = 1:5,
  parsfix = NULL,
  idparsfix = NULL
)
M1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
  lambda_c       mu       K      gamma lambda_a    loglik df conv
1 5.892194 7.805793 1356008 0.02516541 3.244882 -37.10636  5    0
```
:::
:::


Fit model with no carrying capacity


::: {.cell hash='insula_DAISIE_cache/html/M2_51adfc246caf11d21132dae5d7d1ed1c'}

```{.r .cell-code}
M2<-DAISIE_ML(
  datalist = insula_data_list,
  initparsopt = c(1.5,1.1,0.009,1.1),
  idparsopt = c(1,2,4,5),
  parsfix = Inf,
  idparsfix = 3,
  ddmodel=0
)
M2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
  lambda_c       mu   K      gamma lambda_a    loglik df conv
1 5.896242 7.810848 Inf 0.02519944 3.206366 -37.10633  4    0
```
:::
:::


Fit model with no anagenesis


::: {.cell hash='insula_DAISIE_cache/html/M3_feeb5bd041075ea006abf4ec5588a7ab'}

```{.r .cell-code}
M3<-DAISIE_ML(
  datalist = insula_data_list,
  initparsopt = c(1.5,1.1,0.009),
  idparsopt = c(1,2,4),
  parsfix = c(Inf,0),
  idparsfix = c(3,5),
  ddmodel=0
)
M3
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
  lambda_c       mu   K      gamma lambda_a    loglik df conv
1 6.729751 8.726048 Inf 0.02742398        0 -37.29935  3    0
```
:::
:::


Save model results in a table


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
model_results<-rbind(M1,M2,M3)
model_results
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
  lambda_c       mu       K      gamma lambda_a    loglik df conv
1 5.892194 7.805793 1356008 0.02516541 3.244882 -37.10636  5    0
2 5.896242 7.810848     Inf 0.02519944 3.206366 -37.10633  4    0
3 6.729751 8.726048     Inf 0.02742398 0.000000 -37.29935  3    0
```
:::
:::


Create AIC function for model comparison


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
AIC_compare<- function(LogLik,k){
  aic <- (2*k)-(2*LogLik)
  return(aic)
}
```
:::


Compute AIC for all the models


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
AICs<-AIC_compare(c(M1$loglik ,M2$loglik, M3$loglik),c(M1$df,M2$df,M3$df))
names(AICs)<-c('M1','M2','M3')
AICs
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
      M1       M2       M3 
84.21273 82.21265 80.59871 
```
:::
:::


In this case, the preferred model is M3.

## Simulate islands based on parameters from preferred model

Run simulations


::: {.cell hash='insula_DAISIE_cache/html/Simulations_9464cd2186cb261d4d9ab68a54b65069'}

```{.r .cell-code}
Insula_sims<-DAISIE_sim(
  time=4,
  M=1000,
  pars=as.numeric(M3[1:5]),
  replicates= 100,
  verbose = 1,
  plot_sims = FALSE)
```
:::


Plot simulations


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
DAISIE_plot_sims(Insula_sims)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](insula_DAISIE_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-17-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


It looks like *Insula* diversity in the island of Jamaica is at a dynamic equilibrium.
